The Kentucky Kid
From a little high school in
Paducah, Kentucky, Quint Langstaff came to Hopkins In 1946 to
become a leader both on and off
the football field.
President of the sophomore,
junior, and now senior class in
addition to four years of varsity
football competition, the blueeyed, baby-faced co-captain has
displayed such leadership qualities
that he was selected into ()DK
honorary fraternity last spring.
Langstaff came off his high
school campus as a speedy tack
but in his initial appearances on
the Homewood Field tla was converted into an adept end, used
mainly on defense and occasionally
on the attack.

The Kentucky Kid
From a little high school in
Paducah, Kentucky, Quint Langstaff came to Hopkins In 1946 to
become a leader both on and off
the football field.
President of the sophomore,
junior, and now senior class in
addition to four years of varsity
football competition, the blueeyed, baby-faced co-captain has
displayed such leadership qualities
that he was selected into ()DK
honorary fraternity last spring.
Langstaff came off his high
school campus as a speedy tack
but in his initial appearances on
the Homewood Field tla was converted into an adept end, used
mainly on defense and occasionally
on the attack.
